7mmVnkr_1hElbhw9V__Omw.text: They were quick to accommodate our party of seven on Father's day. The wait inside would have been 45 minutes so we took the patio. I don't know how their patio is so cool on a hot summer afternoon but don't be afraid to sit outside. Food and drinks are outstanding. I wish I could remember our waitress' name but she was wonderful and attentive. Limelight goes down real easy. And you can't go wrong with any of the tacos, burgers or steak!

UEoviOdYzhXtbmLBb9cHyA.text: Rib Tacos!! I was taken here with no expectations and I was blown away. Fantastic food and great atmosphere all around. The Rib Tacos are amazing and if you like Ribs or Tacos you can't go wrong, and if you like both it's a no brainer. We also got the trout dip appetizer as a recommendation from the waitress and that was pleasantly surprising as well!

Y4-2i-q0mLZ_Hs9XZozhYg.text: I first went to Chelsea's Kitchen with my dad. As I've said many times, my dad lives for the latest and greatest in fine dining and this time he picked Chelsea's Kitchen. CHELSEA'S KITCHEN Chelsea's Kitchen is owned by parent company LGO Hospitality. The name "La Grande Orange" (LGO) was inspired by the creators looking through historical books on Southern California. A pictorial review of the vast citrus groves that provide the United States with much of it's fruit were always part of California. Inspired by that piece of Americana, they pay reverence to those good times, positive vibes, and winning spirit. LGO Hospitality includes, The Misfit, LGO Grocery & Pizzeria, Chelsea's Kitchen, LGO Cafe, The Luggage Room, Ingo's Tasty Food, Ingo's Tasty Diner, LGO Bake Shop, Grateful Spoon Gelato, and Buck & Rider. THE STORY & SERVICE EXPERIENCE My dad and I were seated at a lovely table on the patio. My only complaint about the patio is the amount of leaves that fall into the food and drinks, but hey, that's not really a problem, is it? We ordered some drinks. I tried the Diego Rivera, which was Frida Kahlo Blanco Tequila, Grapefruit juice, and fresh Thyme. Nom Nom Super Yummy! I had the paella and my dad had the daily catch. OMG my paella was YUMMY and HUGE! My meal included an extremely generous portion of seafood and fresh sausages. The staff has been WELL selected, which speaks to the professionalism of the management. The staff was not OVERLY friendly, which I appreciated, and they had their timing down; always around when we needed something, yet not hovering either. CONCLUSION I had an incredible meal and pleasant stay at Chelsea's Kitchen. I will definitely be back! 5/5 RECOMMEND OF NOTE *Parking is a bit hectic. We used the Valet. *For more information: chelseaskitchenaz.com

b62n_gwXTvJEZN_FwW3Vuw.text: After years of going to this restaurant it's time to leave them some love on Yelp!!! It's our absolute favorite for lunch or dinner. It's kid friendly and we love all the healthy choices for our family. The ambiance is great for visiting friends or family with it's beautiful patio especially when the weather is nice. It's also great for meeting up with girlfriends for a pitcher of yummy sangria. Our favorite is the Ceviche as a starter, the Kale Salad is to die for and it's a toss up between the Prime Rib, the Sirloin Tacos or the Green Chile Burger with their signature fries. We always finish with their amazing Red Velvet cake that's layered with delicious cream cheese worth every calorie and a French Pressed Coffee. After 8 years it's still our favorite we appreciate their consistency from service to food!!

FNjNk4Z-4uqv6dOwcMx9iA.text: I was in town for a conference and luckily found Chelsea's here on Yelp. We arrived right at 12 and the restaurant was already jumping. We lucked out and got a table out on the beautiful patio. They had heaters and a wood fire going to keep us warm on the cooler afternoon. Our server gave us a few recommendations of her favorites and I'm glad I took her advice and ordered the ahi tacos. The ahi was perfectly cooked rare and came with homemade corn tortillas, salsa, guacamole and a few sauces. The unassuming kale salad side was phenomenal. I'm not sure what was in it but I could have eaten another plate of it. My friend ordered the short rib tacos and the portion was enormous and the meat super tender. Lunch was super pricey but I wasn't paying so I'm not complaining.

photos.caption: Photo of Chelsea's Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

K1KnXgNN_MmaDTto6aWpgA.text: In Tempe, AZ for work and found this place on Yelp and went based on the reviews I read. Super cute, fun restaurant. I ordered a hamburger. Seriously, a hamburger and I'm giving this a 4-star review. I think a hamburger is just a hamburger so I can't really explain this other than it was delicious! Our server, who was super friendly, explained that they make all their beef there. Not sure what that means but if you're looking for a unique place to go, I recommend this place! I probably would have given this a five except for the place got so loud as the night went on we could hardly hear each other.

uPGf224ejSFG4LLOBex_6Q.text: Definitely my go to for a casual dinner out or happy hour. The food is amazing and locally sourced, and the restaurant just has a really friendly and open atmosphere.  The Prickly Pear Margarita is always delicious, paired with the Chicken Nachitos is heaven on earth. The Howie Burger is what I usually get. All of their burger meat is ground in house for service which I love! Taco platters are another entree option, I've tried all of them and they are all amazing. You can't leave without dessert and Chelsea's Kitchen's Key Lime Pie is irresistible to me. Just the right amount of tart with a huge layer of whipped cream accompanied by strawberry sorbet that perfectly completes your meal. Will be back very soon.

4ED6cwP8nhBPxkQJWHQQhA.text: Nothing great about it. The customer consumed based is heavily white. If you are of minority don't bother coming to this establishment as you will not be served properly or similar to the others of white race. Food is not great and pretty bland. Service was poor as we weren't treated fairly. I will not be coming here again.

H5rhCGt5F1nRyaSAnJ5jHQ.text: We love the veggie taco plate! We are vegetarian and it can be more difficult to find something we really love! The tacos come with massive sides to stuff them with, and there are so yummy! My boyfriend and I can share the meal and we both leave really full! If you have extra room, the key lime pie is TO DIE FOR! It's comes with sorbet and it's one of the most delicious treats!

rnsxA7Rypwnt1vMYASflEQ.text: Imagine your mothers kitchen turned into the best restaurant in town. This place is incredibly homey while still maintaining the air of a nice restaurant. To top it all off, the food is delicious. Order the short rib tacos and don't forget to grab a homemade cookie on the way out!

oXHnN5JAa5y3MseQyjGexg.text: Awesome experience dining for lunch today.  We were greeted and seated quickly by Jessica, she was pleasant and made sure the high chair we requested was cleaned off. Going out with little ones isn't always so welcomed so we were grateful!  Our server, Aly, was knowledgeable about the vegan options on the menu and I let her choose between the veggie burger and the vegetarian tacos--she chose tacos which were wonderful and a good size serving! My sister had the brussel sprout salad with the optional bacon (pictured) and loved the simplicity of the ingredients paired together.  The patio was perfect for our temperature/shade preference and the bathrooms were clean :)

Be5gu4RW_fVwjUUDQ3OvrQ.text: I've had the pleasure of eating here a few times. Parking is actually pretty decent for the area, but they do have a complimentary valet if you need it. It isn't my favorite brunch place, but I love their dinner. The tacos are to die for, and they even make their own tortillas! It's in the LGO family, so they have the famous salted chocolate chip cookies waiting for you at the entrance.

uQkHAYBCCRfBHB4BT9DtGQ.text: It's an awesome brunch place and definitely worth the try. We ordered a variety of dishes and everyone was happy with their order. I ordered the Short Ribs Hash and I could not get enough of it. The service size was huge  so it was so worth it. Their mimosa glass size was a little disappointing, but the meal and service made up for it.   If you are planning to go for brunch be prepared to wait. Everything on the menu looked amazing and the service didn't miss a beat. A must try brunch place.
